alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:55PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 555 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Zia Pueblo, or 14 miles northwest of Rio Rancho. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Rio Rancho, San Ysidro, Zia Pueblo and Jemez Pueblo. This includes Highway 550 between Mile Markers 12 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area
